Key Match Events: RJ Barrett nailed a three-pointer at the halftime buzzer to tie the game at 61.
Chris Boucher erupted for five three-pointers and 23 points off the bench.
Scottie Barnes had 24 points and 10 rebounds.
Darius Garland went off for 40 points on 14-for-22 shooting for Cleveland.
Toronto led after 12 minutes (33-27), the first time since December 22.
Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland rested scoring leader and top player Donovan Mitchell for a Raptors team it was favoured to beat by 15.5 points.
Ochai Agbaji missed his first game of the season due to a hip pointer.
Post-Match Reflections: After a Barrett jump shot brought Toronto within two points with two minutes remaining, Garland hit a three-pointer and free throws, Allen hit a pair too and the Raptors didnâ€™t score again until Barnes dunked near the end.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Toronto actually hit nine three-pointers in the half, the same number as Cleveland, and did it on eight fewer attempts.

It was the ninth time all season Cleveland had trailed after three quarters, and per the broadcast, it would have been the biggest difference in winning percentage in a Raptors upset win in franchise history.
